alert.note: Alert for Johnston; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 11 at 7:31PM EDT until August 11 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL WAKE AND NORTH CENTRAL JOHNSTON COUNTIES... At 731 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Garner, or near Raleigh, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Cary, Garner, Clayton, Zebulon, Knightdale, Wendell, Lake Wheeler, Flowers and Lake Benson. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
